snippet: Abu Sayyaf, who was involved in the Islamic State’s military operations and helped managed oil and gas sales, was killed during a raid in Syria, the Pentagon said.
abstract: Raid by American ground troops in eastern Syria kills Islamic State leader, known as Abu Sayyaf, and other militants, in first successful attack since military campaign began in 2014; Delta Force commandos also take leader's wife and free a Yazidi woman who was held captive by militants.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear contributed reporting from Washington, and Rukmini Callimachi from New York.

lead_paragraph: Abu Sayyaf, who was involved in the Islamic State’s military operations and helped managed oil and gas sales, was killed during a raid in Syria, the Pentagon said.

headline.main:
ISIS Official
Killed in U.S. Raid in Syria,
Pentagon Says
headline.print_headline: U.S. Commandos Kill an ISIS Leader in Syria
